form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Received; read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Power Act to provide that any inaction by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission that allows a rate change to go into effect shall be treated as an order by the Commission for purposes of rehearing and court review.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fair Ratepayer Accountability, Transparency, and Efficiency Standards Act or the Fair RATES Act.

section.header: Amendment to the Federal Power Act
section.text: Subsection (d) of section 205 of the Federal Power Act (16 U.S.C. 824d(d)) is amended by adding at the end the following: Any absence of action by the Commission that allows a change to take effect under this section, including the Commission allowing the 60 daysâ€™ notice herein provided to expire without Commission action, shall be treated as an order issued by the Commission accepting such change for purposes of section 313..

attestation-group.attestation-date: Passed the House of Representatives January 23, 2017.
